titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dudley Poore Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 03:13

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence, notebooks and diaries, writings, photographs, and other materials documenting the personal and professional life of American poet and author Dudley Poore. Poore was part of a circle of writers at Harvard University that included e.e. cummings, John Dos Passos, Robert Hillyer, Robert Stewart Mitchell, and Cuthbert Wright, and the correspondence features letters with these associates, as well as John Peale Bishop, Dudley Fitts, Robert Finch, Arthur K. McComb, Katherine Anne Porter, and others. The correspondence includes approximately 850 letters from Poore to his parents, much of which dates from Poore's days as a student and his service in the Army Ambulance Corps and Red Cross during World War One. Notebooks and diaries contain journal entries, drafts of literary projects and correspondence, travel logs, and student notebooks, as well as diaries Poore kept while serving in Europe during the war. The collection also contains drafts of writings, family and personal photographs, and other papers.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from the William Reese Company on various funds, 1984.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Dudley Poore papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Dudley Poore Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization upon acquisition. Further organization and description were carried out in 2012. Descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call number: Uncat Za Ms 320.

bioghist.head: Dudley Poore (1893-1981)
bioghist.p: Dudley Poore, American author and translator, was the son of Alvin B. and Mary L. Poore. He was educated at Harvard University prior to the First World War and, during the war, served in the Army Ambulance Corps and Red Cross. Poetry by Poore is included in Eight Harvard Poets (1917) and his translations of Spanish and Portugese works include Our Daily Bread (1943) by Enrique Gil Gilbert and The Bonfire (1944) by Cecilio J. Carneiro. Poore also co-edited the selections Fiesta in November: Stories fron Latin America (1942) and Cuentistas norteamericanos (1946).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers contain correspondence, notebooks and diaries, writings, photographs, and other materials documenting the personal and professional life of American poet and author Dudley Poore. Poore was part of a circle of writers at Harvard University before WWI that included e.e. cummings, John Dos Passos, Robert Hillyer, Robert Stewart Mitchell, and Cuthbert Wright, published together in Eight Harvard Poets (1917), and the correspondence features letters with these associates, as well as John Peale Bishop, Dudley Fitts, Robert Finch, Arthur K. McComb, Katherine Anne Porter, and others. The correspondence also includes approximately 850 letters from Poore to his parents, much of which dates from Poore's days as a student and his service in the Army Ambulance Corps and Red Cross during the war. Notebooks and diaries contain daily journal entries, drafts of literary projects and correspondence, travel logs, and student notebooks, as well as diaries Poore kept while serving in Europe during the war. The collection also contains drafts of writings, family and personal photographs, and other papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Correspondence, 1915-1975. II. Notebooks and Diaries, 1906-1970s. III. Writings, 1927-1940s. IV. Photographs, 1840s-1969. V. Other Papers, [circa 1915-1940s].

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries for General and Family Correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. Correspondence features correspondence with authors, publishers, and Poore's family. Poore was part of a small circle of writers at Harvard University before WWI, including e.e. cummings, John Dos Passos, Robert Hillyer, Robert Stewart Mitchell, and Cuthbert Wright, published together in Eight Harvard Poets (1917). General Correspondence features letters from these Harvard associates, as well as John Peale Bishop, Dudley Fitts, Robert Finch, Arthur K. McComb, Katherine Anne Porter, and others.
General Correspondence includes some third-party correspondence. Unsorted correspondence is listed at the end of the alphabetical run of named correspondents.

Family correspondence features approximately 850 pieces of correspondence from Poore to his parents, Alvin and Mary Poore, much of which dates from Poore's days as a student at Harvard and his service in the Army Ambulance Corps and Red Cross during the war.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials arranged as received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II. Notebooks and Diaries contains journals, drafts of literary projects and correspondence, travel logs, and lecture notebooks, as well as diaries Poore kept while serving in Europe during the First World War.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Writings arranged as received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III. Writings consists chiefly of works by Poore, but includes writings by others. Poore's writings include drafts of poems, short stories, plays, novels, translations, and a memoir of his years as a student at Harvard University.
Unsorted and identified writings can be found at the end of the writings listed by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV. Photographs contains photographs, negatives, and printed material. There are images of Poore, Robert Finch, and others and examples of early photographic processes, such as tintypes, daguerrotypes, and photographs on glass.

did.unittitle: Murphy pars I and II, sheet negatives

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials arranged in the order in which they were received by the library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. Other Papers contains miscellaneous personal and family papers, including identification papers, sketchbooks, financial and legal records, and printed materials.
